content.raw:
My issue is that leaving the scenebroadcaster out silently causes both the GUI and logging to fail. It will also cause any downstream user relying on on the publication of pose information to fail, which is true for subt. I'm open to alternative ideas, but having a critical feature like this hinge on someone remembering to include a plugin in an SDF file is not great.

We could, for example, load a default set of plugins and leave them in a "disabled" state. They could become "enabled" when certain criteria are met, such as loading the gui, or logging.
